attributes.comment:
In reference to increasing fees for I-600/600A, N-565, N-600, and Biometric
Services (fingerprints) it is penalizing and putting unnecessary hardships on
people who are extending themselves to help others who are in dire need. These
fees directly affect people who are adopting a child or children and with the
proposed price increase, which is substantial, could make a difference in
someone?s decision to adopt. Every child needs a family that loves them and
cares about them. This should be the priority, not how much money we can make
from adopting parents.

We are in the process of adopting and our I-171H, which is only good for 18
months, has expired, because the process has slowed down. We now have to re-
file our I-600/600A, which means we have to pay again for our I-171H. This is
another unjust fee that we have to pay. I think that you should leave the fees as
they are and consider a change to the re-filing fee, as this is a matter of extending
the original form for more than 18 months. It should not cost the same.

Brad

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Brad
